we're doing DevOps we're not willy-nilly making changes live in production we're

consistent platform so once an issue has been raised and it's validated that a

start doing is as soon as we check in to code it triggers a code review and
assuming everything is fine it triggers an automated deployment with something
like a custom continuous integration service like Travis or Jenkins or with
some type of managed AWS service like code deploy and recently I've had the
pleasure of working with Amazon code deploy and I have to say it's really shifting the way our quality assurance
team looks at software when we make a change they see it and we had
deployments auto hooked from github using the code deploy service being available in the test site within one

here is that once we get into this pipeline of testing staging and production all of these environments are
intended to be exactly the same so there is no let's just hope it works in
